greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of partitions of n having k distinct parts i (i>=2) of multiplicity i-1 (n>=0).
comment: Sum of entries in row n is A000041(n) (the partition numbers).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..1000, flattened
example: The partition [1,1,2,3,3,3,3,4,4,4] has 2 parts i of multiplicity i-1: 2 and 4.
maple: g := mul((t-1)*x^(i*(i+1))+1/(1-x^(i+1)), i = 1 .. 100)/(1-x): gser := simplify(series(g, x = 0, 35)): for n from 0 to 30 do P[n] := sort(coeff(gser, x, n)) end do: for n from 0 to 30 do seq(coeff(P[n], t, k), k = 0 .. degree(P[n])) end do; # yields sequence in triangular form
b:= proc(n, i) option remember; expand(
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..degree(p)))(b(n$2)):
mathematica: b[n_, i_] := b[n, i] = Expand[If[n==0, 1, If[i<1, 0, Sum[If[i-1 == j, x, 1]*b[n-i*j, i-1], {j, 0, n/i}]]]]; T[n_] := Function[p, Table[ Coefficient[p, x, i], {i, 0, Exponent[p, x]}]][b[n, n]]; Table[T[n], {n, 0, 30}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 08 2016 after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Oct 10 2016
